title: Representing Text Chunks
descriptions:
Abstract:

This paper compares seven different data representation formats for the recognition of base noun phrases (NPs) using memory-based learning (MBL). The authors investigate the influence of data representation on the performance of chunking systems and aim to improve the best reported results for this task. The study uses the Wall Street Journal corpus and presents the results of various experiments, including 5-fold cross-validation and cascaded classification. The authors find that the I0B1 format, introduced by Ramshaw and Marcus in 1995, consistently performs well, but the differences with other formats are not significant. The 1-IG algorithm is able to improve the best reported F1 rates for a standard data set, but the results are sensitive to redundant input features. The study suggests that future research should focus on exploring the parameter space of the 1-IG algorithm using standard search algorithms and improving the performance of POS taggers.
